decks.notes: The deck relies on a disruptive strategy that combines aggressive creatures with cards that slow down the opponent's game plan. By using tax effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Vryn Wingmare, along with disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker and Magus of the Moon, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base and spells while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Mother of Runes. The deck also includes equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance its aggression and protect its creatures.

The deck aims to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to search for Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. By sacrificing Vampire Hexmage or using Sylvan Safekeeper to protect the combo, the player can create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token in just a few turns. The deck also includes disruption cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Pithing Needle to control the opponent's game plan and ensure the combo can be safely executed.

The main concept of this Dark Depths combo deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo, allowing for a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token to be created. The deck utilizes various tutors such as Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to find the combo pieces efficiently, while also including disruption in the form of discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. Additionally, protection is provided through cards like Pithing Needle and Sylvan Safekeeper to ensure the combo goes off successfully. The deck aims to win the game swiftly by overwhelming the opponent with the powerful Marit Lage token.

The deck focuses on using efficient removal spells and counterspells to control the board while generating card advantage through powerful planeswalkers and card draw spells. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up resources and eventually overwhelming them with superior card quality. By utilizing a mix of removal, disruption, and card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and dictate the pace of the game, ultimately grinding out a win through incremental advantage.

This Legacy Control Landstill deck focuses on utilizing Standstill to control the board while using powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage to out-value opponents. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Fatal Push to disrupt opponents' plans, along with removal spells like Diabolic Edict and Innocent Blood. The deck runs a solid land base with Wasteland to disrupt opponents' mana bases, and Tombstalker as a finisher. This deck aims to out-grind opponents and control the game until it can close out with its threats.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on early disruption and aggressive creatures to control the tempo of the game. It combines efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember with counterspells like Force of Will and Stifle to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Delver of Secrets to quickly close out the game. By balancing disruption and aggression, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while remaining resilient to disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to use the synergy between various Elf creatures and spells to generate a substantial amount of mana and trigger powerful abilities. The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with cards like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel, while also maintaining card advantage through Glimpse of Nature and Elvish Visionary. The end goal is to use Natural Order to bring out the game-winning Craterhoof Behemoth, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful attack. This deck aims to win the game through explosive combos and efficient use of mana acceleration.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to utilize the powerful Eldrazi creatures, such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also benefiting from lands like Eye of Ugin and Ancient Tomb to ramp into your big threats, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control to secure a faster victory.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. It also includes mana-denial elements like Wasteland and City of Traitors to gain an advantage in the early game. The use of Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin helps to ramp into the larger Eldrazi creatures, while cards like Umezawa's Jitte provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure on opponents quickly and efficiently with its aggressive Eldrazi creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with dredge creatures such as Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll using cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough. By utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy and Dread Return, players can disrupt their opponent's strategy and reanimate powerful creatures from the graveyard. The deck aims to generate a strong board presence through recurring creatures like Ichorid while creating zombie tokens with Bridge from Below. This deck relies on graveyard synergy and high-speed gameplay to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield quickly using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience. The deck focuses on assembling the necessary combo pieces while also including card draw and counterspells for protection. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and win the game in a few turns by leveraging these powerful plays. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Cunning Wish to search for specific answers or combo pieces when needed.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, and then reanimate them onto the battlefield using spells like Reanimate and Exhume. This Combo - Reanimator archetype aims to cheat big, game-changing creatures like Griselbrand, Ashen Rider, and Elesh Norn onto the battlefield ahead of schedule, overwhelming opponents with powerful threats. The deck also includes a strong disruption package with cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opposing strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to gain control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Hymn to Tourach, Force of Will, and Snapcaster Mage, while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Baleful Strix and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to outvalue the opponent. The deck is able to efficiently handle threats with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push, and can close out the game quickly with cards like Bloodbraid Elf and Lightning Bolt.

The deck focuses on disruption and control, utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal, hand disruption, and card advantage to outvalue opponents. It aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's game plan, while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to further control the game. The mana base is designed to support a wide range of spells and efficiently cast them when needed.

The main concept of this deck is to have strong control over the game by using a variety of disruption spells and removal, such as Force of Will, Abrupt Decay, Fatal Push, and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also utilizes powerful card advantage engines like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Snapcaster Mage to maintain consistency and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, the presence of Leovold, Emissary of Trest allows for extra disruption against opposing decks reliant on drawing cards. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, disrupt the opponent's strategies, and win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on efficiently tutoring and casting game-winning creatures, such as Griselbrand and Emrakul, by putting them directly into play through Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The key strategy is to exploit the high power level of these creatures through the use of Omniscience, allowing for multiple big plays in a single turn. The deck includes a suite of cantrips and counterspells to enable consistent and protected combo execution, with additional backup plans in the form of Force of Will to disrupt opposing strategies.
